snippet: The dispute began two months ago when the federal agency sought Apple’s help to gain access to a phone used by an attacker in a mass shooting.
abstract: Apple, in new filing in Federal District in New York, again resists request from FBI to help unlock iPhone used by Brooklyn drug dealer; company's attorneys say case would lead to flood of similar demands.
lead_paragraph: The dispute began two months ago when the federal agency sought Apple’s help to gain access to a phone used by an attacker in a mass shooting.

headline.main: In New Filing, Apple Resists F.B.I.’s Call to Open iPhone in Drug Case
headline.print_headline: Apple Again Resists Call  to Help in New York Case
